text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
The purpose of this IRM is to establish responsibilities for Facilities Management and Security Services (FMSS) Quality Assurance (QA) programs.
Facilities Management and Security Services
Table of Contents
Assurance Programs
page (
) Purpose: The purpose of this IRM is to establish responsibilities for Management and Security Services (FMSS) Quality Assurance (QA) (
) Audience: FMSS managers and employees. (
) Policy Owner: Chief, FMSS. (
) Program Owner: FMSS Associate Director (AD), QA. (
) Primary Stakeholders: FMSS managers and staff. (

) Program Goals: To improve FMSS program processes, monitor program adherence to guidance, and implement IRS policy on Audits, Internal ment Documents (IMD), and the Balanced Performance Measurement (BPMS) and Enterprise Risk Management (ERM). (
) This IRM section provides clariﬁcation on the role of the QA organization FMSS. (

) QA partners with FMSS functions and activities to: a. Improve program effectiveness by conducting reviews and analyses. b. Identify program processes and controls that are not operating in dance with policy, procedures, or other requirements. c. Provide technical and analytical support to implement program ments and corrective measures. d. Address requests and inquiries from the Government Accountability Office (GAO), Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration the Chief Financial Officer (CFO), and other organizations auditing programs. e. Ensure IMD (IRM, Policy Statements, Delegation Orders, etc.) are aligned and current. f. Gather and report FMSS performance measures as part of the IRS’s BPMS. g. Maintain the Risk Register and Key Risk Indicators (KRI), collect and report FMSS risk identiﬁcation and assessment activities and facilitate integration of risk in the decision-making process. (

The Commissioner of Internal Revenue has authority under Treasury Order 150-10 to administer and enforce the Internal Revenue laws. The Commis- sioner provides subordinates certain authorities to act on his behalf by
1.57 Facilities Management and Security Services Quality Assurance

Facilities Management and Security Quality Assurance Delegations of Authority. IRS directors throughout the IRS, with the and responsibility for a program, issue IMD to administer and enforce the Internal Revenue laws. (

, Balanced System for Measuring Organizational and Performance Within the Internal Revenue Service. (

, Management’s Responsibility for Enterprise Risk Management and Internal Control. (
) The Chief, FMSS is authorized to prescribe QA programs within FMSS. (
) The AD, QA is responsible for planning, developing, implementing, and controlling the QA programs. (

) The Section Chief, Program Review Team is responsible for planning, ing, implementing, managing, and evaluating the Quality Assurance Review (QAR) program and ensuring that IRS policies and procedures are (

) The Section Chief, Audit Team is responsible for planning, developing, menting, managing, and evaluating FMSS’s Audit, IMD, BPMS and ERM processes and ensuring that IRS policies and procedures are followed. (

) FMSS program owners are responsible for: a. Responding to requests and inquiries from QA personnel. b. Cooperating with QA personnel to improve the accountability and operation of FMSS programs, strengthen controls, and address cies. c. Identifying areas within their programs that may beneﬁt from a review submitting a request to *FMSS QAR Suggestions. (

) Program Reports: The QA program reports include: a. Quality Assurance Review (QAR) reports b. Summary of Analysis (SOA) c. Deputy Commissioner Business Performance Reviews (BPR) d. Open Audit and Planned Corrective Actions (PCA) reports (
) Program Effectiveness: QA uses performance metrics to measure the tiveness of reviews and, when possible, improvements made in response QA recommendations. (
) Management exercises continuous oversight of projects and program through regular project status meetings and status reporting. (
) A documentation trail of reviews, approvals, coordination activities and key decisions is maintained in compliance with policy for each QA program. (

) The status of audits, corrective actions, audit inquiries, and requests is program risks and mitigations are documented and reviewed/updated cally; and a documentation trail on issues, actions, and resolutions is Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

Delegations of Authority. IRS directors throughout the IRS, with the authority and responsibility for a program, issue IMD to administer and enforce the Internal Revenue laws.
1.57.1.1.4 (04-12-2021) Program Management and Review
Management exercises continuous oversight of projects and program through regular project status meetings and status reporting.
A documentation trail of reviews, approvals, coordination activities and key decisions is maintained in compliance with policy for each QA program.
) Data dictionaries are developed and maintained to document compliance with policy requirements for BPMS measures. (
) Access to program documentation, reports and information is centralized and stored on a Shar
oint site with access limited to authorized personnel. (

) The following terms and deﬁnitions apply to this IRM section: a. Action Plan – A detailed plan outlining actions needed to reach one or more goals. b. Audit – An assessment of FMSS program activities performed by the Government Accountability Office, Treasury Inspector General for Tax ministration, Chief Financial Officer, or a federal organization. c. Balanced Performance Measurement System (BPMS) – The IRS per- formance measurement system for setting organizational objectives, establishing targets, assessing progress and results, and evaluating vidual performance. d. Close-out Record – A written agreement that documents any transfer responsibilities for a process or activity from FMSS to another IRS Business Unit or office when transfer is the agreed upon solution. e. Data Collection Instrument (DCI) – A form or spreadsheet used to document testing results when multiple records, observations, transac- tions, or cases are tested in a monitoring focused QAR. The DCI identiﬁes the speciﬁc guidance tested and the testing results. f. Data Dictionary – A document that describes a performance measure in detail, including formal deﬁnition, responsible official, data source, data reliability, and program controls. g.

ibrary – The repository for FMSS IMD products. h. ERM Liaisons – The designated officials that serve as ambassadors/ champions for risk management and support their business unit leadership in identifying, assessing and managing risk that, if not mitigated, will undermine the attainment of their business unit’s and/or the IRS’s goals and mission. i. Guidance – The source of criteria or standards against which a is tested in a monitoring focused QAR. j. Internal Management Document (IMD) – An official communication that designates policies, authorities, and delivers instructions to IRS officials employees. k. Key Risk Indicators (KRI) – Provide timely leading indicators of existing and emerging risks that allow the business unit to recognize and respond to risks before they are realized. l. Matter for Further Consideration (MFC) – A notiﬁcation from GAO that identiﬁes an instance of non-conformance with internal control standards, provisions of the Internal Revenue Manual, or other applicable guidance. m. Planned Corrective Actions (PCA) – A detailed description of how agement plans to implement a recommendation to address the audit ﬁnding(s). The PCA also identiﬁes due date(s) and responsible official(s). n. Process Flow Diagram – A graphical representation of a process or workﬂow identifying processing steps and who performs them. o. Program Owner – A manager with primary responsibility for establishing policies and procedures and/or managing a program. p. Project Status Report – A periodic report of progress on a QAR project delivered by the Project Lead to management.
Access to program documentation, reports and information is centralized and stored on a SharePoint site with access limited to authorized personnel.
Facilities Management and Security Services Quality Assurance

q. Quality Assurance Review (QAR) – In an improvement focused QAR, program processes are reviewed to identify underlying causes for issues and opportunities to improve efficiency and effectiveness. In a monitoring focused QAR, program processes are reviewed to determine if policies, procedures, and controls were implemented effectively and, as identify corrective measures. r. Risk Register – A template for business units to document and report information in a standardized format to the Office of the Chief Risk (OCRO) for enterprise risk assessment updates. s. Stakeholders – Organizations or persons with program policy ties or with a vested interest in a program. t. Summary of Analysis (SOA) – A document that identiﬁes the causes for the issues under review and proposes solutions for improvement. u. Testing Approach – A planning document that identiﬁes the that will be used to evaluate program processes during a monitoring focused QAR. v. Testing Summary – A document that describes testing performed and results in a monitoring focused QAR.

1.57 Facilities Management and Security Services Quality Assurance
Management designates a project lead for each improvement-focused QAR

a. Audit reports, Matters for Further Consideration (MFC) forms, corrective action documentation b. IRM, procedures, desk guides, program documents c. Training courses d. Subject Matter Experts (SME) e. Other historical and current material that may be relevant to the project objectives
Prepare a Summary of Assessment documenting the results of the analysis of information gathered during discovery and the proposed solution(s). The SOA
Support the program owner’s implementation of the solution. Complex process improvements may require development of an action plan.
Note: If the solution requires program responsibilities to be transferred to another Business Unit or group, a written agreement should be used to document the decision in a close-out record.
Evaluate the solution(s) and identify and document recommendations for im- provement or follow-on actions, as necessary.
The project lead submits project status reports to management and attends recurring oversight meetings at management’s discretion throughout the QAR
Test program adherence to guidance. Testing techniques include:
The following organizations establish IRS Audit oversight policies:
Facilities Management and Security Services Quality Assurance

a. Office of the Chief Risk Officer, Enterprise Audit Management (TIGTA, GAO, and Federal agency audits, except for the IRS Financial Audit) b. CFO, Financial Management Division (IRS Financial Statement Audit), and Internal Control Division (IRS QA Program, Financial Assurance Control Testing, Internal Control Reviews) (

) The QA Audit Team is responsible for managing FMSS’s implementation of Audit oversight program. This includes: a. Coordinating information and access requests with affected functions areas. b. Providing management and program owners analysis and insight on issues. c. Monitoring and reporting on the status of audits and planned corrective actions. (
) The QA Audit Team follows applicable IRS policies and FMSS Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), which include but are not limited to: a. IRM
, Resource Guide for Managers, Monitoring and Improving Internal Control b. IRM

) IMD are official communications that designate authorities and/or provide in- structions to IRS officials and employees. IMD include IRM, Delegation Internal Policy Statements, Interim Guidance, SOP and Operating Level Directives. Documents (
) The Office of Servicewide Policy, Directives and Electronic Resources (SPDER), within the Research, Applied Analytics and Statistics (RAAS) zation establishes IRS IMD policy. (

) The QA IMD Team is responsible for managing FMSS’s implementation of IMD program. IMD coordinators manage program activities, including acting a clearing house for all IMD products, verifying all IMD products are current and providing support to IMD authors. (
) The QA IMD Team follows applicable IRS policies and FMSS SOP, which include but are not limited to: a. IRM

) The IRS developed the BPMS to reﬂect its priorities consistent with its and strategic goals. The IRS considers each of the three components of and Reporting balanced measures (customer satisfaction, employee satisfaction, and for the business results) when setting organizational objectives, establishing targets, assessing progress and results and evaluating individual performance. Each System component is given an equal importance. Enterprise (
) The Corporate Budget office within the CFO organization establishes the IRS (ERM) BPMS policy. (

) The IRS developed the ERM Program to provide an IRS-wide approach to management and foster a risk-aware culture. The program helps IRS units corporate risk management principles in the decision-making process. (
) The OCRO organization establishes the IRS ERM policy. (

) The QA Measures Team is responsible for managing the FMSS implementa- tion of the BPMS program, including collecting and reporting FMSS performance measures and providing guidance to FMSS divisions to develop measures. The Measures Team is also responsible for maintaining the Risk Register and KRI, collecting and reporting FMSS risk identiﬁcation and ment activities and facilitating the integration of risk in the decision-making process. (
) The QA Measures Team follows applicable IRS policies and FMSS SOP, include but are not limited to: a. IRM
